hippodrome

Class ControlCentre

  • java.lang.Object
    • hippodrome.ControlCentre
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ControlCentreInterface, java.rmi.Remote

    public class ControlCentre
extends java.lang.Object
implements ControlCentreInterface
    Place where the Spectators go to enjoy the race (at a Watching Stand) and the Broker controls the races and publishes its results.
    Since:
    0.1

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ControlCentre(GeneralInformationRepositoryInterface repository, int numberOfHorses)
      Creates a Control Centre.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Response entertainTheGuests()
      Start entertaining the guests (representation of the Spectators), as the Broker's actions can be considered as terminated.
      int getNumberOfEntitiesDeclaringExit()
      Gives the number of entities running on this hippodrome region which will exit the simulation.
      void goCheckHorses()
      Signal given by the last Spectator which arrives at the Paddock to appraise the horses, notifying the summonHorsesToPaddock() of the Broker.
      Response goWatchTheRace(int spectator)
      Changes the state of the Spectator to Watching a Race (WAR) and waits till the reportResults() of the Entities.
      void makeAMove(int horseJockeyId)
      Signal given the last horse has crossed the finish line, notifying the startTheRace() in order to relief the Broker from the state Supervising the Race (STR), as the race is over.
      Response proceedToPaddock(int horseJockeyId)
      Signal given by the last pair Horse/Jockey that arrives on Paddock, notifying the waitForTheNextRace(int) of the Spectators.
      Response relaxABit(int spectator)
      Relax a bit from the games, as this is could be the final transition of a Spectator lifecycle.
      int reportResults()
      Signal that the race is over, having the publishing of the results by the Broker performing its job.
      Response startTheRace()
      Changes the state of the Broker to Supervising the Race (STR) and waits till the last makeAMove(int) is performed by a pair Horse/Jockey.
      Response summonHorsesToPaddock()
      Changes the state of the Entities to Announcing Next Race (ANR) and waits till the last goCheckHorses() from the last Spectator to arrive on Paddock.
      Response waitForTheNextRace(int spectator)
      Changes the Spectator's state to Waiting for a Race to Start (WFRTS) and waits till the last proceedToPaddock(int) of the pair Horse/Jockey.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ControlCentre

        public ControlCentre(GeneralInformationRepositoryInterface repository,
                     int numberOfHorses)
        Creates a Control Centre.
        This constructor creates a Control Centre giving a number of pairs Horse/Jockeys. Plus, an instance of the repository is also given in order to report status changes on the course of its actions.
        Parameters:
        numberOfHorses - the number of pairs Horse/Jockeys which will compete against one another.
        repository - an instance of a GeneralInformationRepositoryInterface in order to report all the actions and log each and every moment.

    • Method Detail

      • startTheRace

        public Response startTheRace()
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Changes the state of the Broker to Supervising the Race (STR) and waits till the last makeAMove(int) is performed by a pair Horse/Jockey.
        Specified by:
        startTheRace in interface ControlCentreInterface
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the wait() is interrupted.

      • entertainTheGuests

        public Response entertainTheGuests()
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Start entertaining the guests (representation of the Spectators), as the Broker's actions can be considered as terminated.
        Specified by:
        entertainTheGuests in interface ControlCentreInterface
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • waitForTheNextRace

        public Response waitForTheNextRace(int spectator)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Changes the Spectator's state to Waiting for a Race to Start (WFRTS) and waits till the last proceedToPaddock(int) of the pair Horse/Jockey.
        Specified by:
        waitForTheNextRace in interface ControlCentreInterface
        Returns:
        if the last pair Horse/Jockey has arrived on Paddock.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the wait() is interrupted.

      • goWatchTheRace

        public Response goWatchTheRace(int spectator)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Changes the state of the Spectator to Watching a Race (WAR) and waits till the reportResults() of the Entities.
        This method also resets the control variable for the last race results report, the number of horses which have finished the race and the control variable for the startTheRace().
        Specified by:
        goWatchTheRace in interface ControlCentreInterface
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the wait() is interrupted.

      • relaxABit

        public Response relaxABit(int spectator)
        Relax a bit from the games, as this is could be the final transition of a Spectator lifecycle.
        Specified by:
        relaxABit in interface ControlCentreInterface

      • reportResults

        public int reportResults()
        Signal that the race is over, having the publishing of the results by the Broker performing its job.
        Note that this method changes the value of the condition variable to the goWatchTheRace(int) wait condition, notifying its changes.
        Specified by:
        reportResults in interface ControlCentreInterface
        Returns:
        the winner of the current race.

      • summonHorsesToPaddock

        public Response summonHorsesToPaddock()
                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Changes the state of the Entities to Announcing Next Race (ANR) and waits till the last goCheckHorses() from the last Spectator to arrive on Paddock.
        Note that this method also resets its proper condition variable after unlocking itself.
        Specified by:
        summonHorsesToPaddock in interface ControlCentreInterface
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the wait() is interrupted.

      • proceedToPaddock

        public Response proceedToPaddock(int horseJockeyId)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Signal given by the last pair Horse/Jockey that arrives on Paddock, notifying the waitForTheNextRace(int) of the Spectators.
        Note that this method also resets the condition variable of itself after the notification.
        Specified by:
        proceedToPaddock in interface ControlCentreInterface
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • goCheckHorses

        public void goCheckHorses()
        Signal given by the last Spectator which arrives at the Paddock to appraise the horses, notifying the summonHorsesToPaddock() of the Broker.
        Note that this method also resets the condition variable used on the waitForTheNextRace(int).
        Specified by:
        goCheckHorses in interface ControlCentreInterface

      • makeAMove

        public void makeAMove(int horseJockeyId)
        Signal given the last horse has crossed the finish line, notifying the startTheRace() in order to relief the Broker from the state Supervising the Race (STR), as the race is over. This method also helps identifying when a pair Horse/Jockey has won the race.
        Specified by:
        makeAMove in interface ControlCentreInterface

      • getNumberOfEntitiesDeclaringExit

        public int getNumberOfEntitiesDeclaringExit()
        Gives the number of entities running on this hippodrome region which will exit the simulation.
        Specified by:
        getNumberOfEntitiesDeclaringExit in interface ControlCentreInterface
        Returns:
        the number of entities which declares death.
